definition: to avoid a problem by walking away from it/to quit
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it

sentences.english: By far the most common response to dissatisfaction is simply to leave.
sentences.chinese: 而到目前爲止他們對不滿最通常的做法還是一走了之。

sentences.english: He took a powder and left his mother to worry about his gambling debts.
sentences.chinese: 他一走了之，而讓他的母親爲他的賭債發愁。

sentences.english: We have an agreement from which we cannot walkaway.
sentences.chinese: 我們達成一致意見，那就是我們不可能一走了之。

sentences.english: People often simply abandon their pets when they go abroad.
sentences.chinese: 人們出國時常常丟下寵物不管，一走了之。

sentences.english: Walking was what several senior HP managers did during Ms Fiorina's reign.
sentences.chinese: 幾名惠普的高級經理就在費奧瑞納任職期間一走了之。

sentences.english: Flower fining jade does not endure the joke of the destiny, the option left.
sentences.chinese: 瓊花經受不住命運的作弄，選擇一走了之。

sentences.english: He could get up and leave.
But if we leave we lose it.
sentences.chinese: 可是，如果我們一走了之，我們就會失去它。

sentences.english: There is no chance I would walk away.
Shang Xiyao thought empathy dont love the star, a walk it.
sentences.chinese: 湯喜耀以爲星星移情別戀，一走了之。

definition: to stand aside and do nothing (idiom)/to take no part in
to make oneself scarce/to slip away/to take French leave
pinyin: pai1 pai1 pi4 gu5 zou3 ren2

definition: to go far/to escape to faraway places
to leave without saying good-bye
to cast away
to steal away/to beat it
once the main problem is solved, all troubles are solved/death ends all one's troubles
(of marriage or business partners) to break up (idiom)/to separate
completely lacking any feeling or sense of justice (idiom); cold and ruthless
not to get involved/to stay out of it
to fall out with sb and become hostile
obscure/dubious/shady
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
(coll.) to quit one's job in disgust
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
to pay no heed to (idiom)/to ignore/to brush aside
